MainHeading.P: The House assembled in the Oak Room of the Mansion House at 11.45 a.m.

MainHeading.LHead: ELECTION OF SPEAKER, DEPUTY SPEAKER, AND CLERKS
MainHeading.Title: ELECTION OF SPEAKER, DEPUTY SPEAKER, AND CLERKS - ELECTION OF CEANN COMHAIRLE (SPEAKER).
MainHeading.P: COUNT PLUNKETT (N. Roscommon) as senior member, moved that the appointment of SEAN T. UA CEALLAIGH (College Green) as Ceann Comhairle be confirmed.

MainHeading.LHead: ELECTION OF SPEAKER, DEPUTY SPEAKER, AND CLERKS
MainHeading.Title: ELECTION OF SPEAKER, DEPUTY SPEAKER, AND CLERKS - ELECTION OF CEANN IONAID (DEPUTY SPEAKER).
MainHeading.P: On the motion of COUNT PLUNKETT (N. Roscommon) SEAN UA CEALLAIGH (Louth) was appointed Ceann Ionaid, and, in his absence, LIAM DE ROISTE (Cork City) was elected Chairman for the day.
The Deputy for Cork City accordingly took the Chair.

MainHeading.LHead: ELECTION OF SPEAKER, DEPUTY SPEAKER, AND CLERKS
MainHeading.RHead: - APPOINTMENT OF CLERK AND ASSISTANT CLERKS
MainHeading.Title: ELECTION OF SPEAKER, DEPUTY SPEAKER, AND CLERKS - APPOINTMENT OF CLERK AND ASSISTANT CLERKS.
MainHeading.P: In reply to a question from the Chair, the PRIOMH-AIRE stated that the following clerks had been appointed for this session and during the week:—

MainHeading.Title: ELECTION OF SPEAKER, DEPUTY SPEAKER, AND CLERKS - ROLL CALL.
MainHeading.P: The Roll of Members was called over by the Clerk and the following answered to their names:—
The Ceann Ionaid then took the Chair.

MainHeading.LHead: ELECTION OF SPEAKER, DEPUTY SPEAKER, AND
MainHeading.Title: ELECTION OF SPEAKER, DEPUTY SPEAKER, AND CLERKS - MOTION TO EXCLUDE STRANGERS.
MainHeading.P: “During the present Session, the House (except when meeting in the Round Room) shall sit in private from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. and from 3.30 p.m. to 7 p.m. daily, and that no visitor be admitted unless by special permission of the Ceann Comhairle.”

MainHeading.Title: QUESTIONS TO THE AIREACHT - IRISH PRISONERS IN ENGLAND.

Speaker.P: There are two Irishmen in Reading Gaol—MacNestry and O'Rourke. Is there any machinery for securing their release?
Give written notice of that question and it will be answered to-morrow.

MainHeading.Title: QUESTIONS TO THE AIREACHT - PREVIOUS PROCEEDINGS OF DAIL.
MainHeading.P: D. MACGEARAILT (Pembroke): Is there any means of finding out what transpired at former meetings of Dáil?
THE PRIOMH-AIRE: The required information will be available from the Ministerial reports which will be presented later.

MainHeading.Title: MINISTERIAL REPORTS.
MainHeading.P: The reports of the following Ministers having been read:—
their formal adoption was moved by ART O GRIOBHTHA (E. Cavan), seconded by T. MACSUIBHNE (Mid Cork), and after discussion agreed to.

MainHeading.Title: MINISTERIAL REPORTS. - MOTION RE PAYMENT OF DEPUTIES' EXPENSES.
MainHeading.P: The following motion standing in the name of CATHAL BRUGHA (Waterford Co.) was moved by him and seconded by JOSEPH MACDONAGH (Tipperary North).

“That the railway fares of journeys to and from Dáil meetings of Deputies from the country who have previously entered their names in a ‘Special List’ to be kept by the Chairman's clerk and the hotel or lodging expenses of those Deputies while attending Dáil meetings shall be re-imbursed to them on application to be made to the Clerk within a fortnight, and that the foregoing order be inserted in the Standing Orders as Standing Order 15, and that the Standing Order hitherto numbered 15 be re-numbered 16, and that Deputies from the country entering their names in the ‘Special List’ during the Session at which this Order is made shall be entitled to the benefit of this Order in respect of the present Session.”
SEAN MAC AN TSAOI (Monaghan South) moved as an amendment:—

“That each Deputy attending Sessions of the Dáil be allowed the 3rd class return railway fare from his ordinary place of residence, and, in addition, be paid a maintenance allowance of 15/- per diem during his attendance at the Dáil.” Amendment seconded by COUNTESS MARKIEVICZ (St. Patrick's), but withdrawn on the undertaking of the Priomh-Aire that it would be understood that no Deputy should receive more than 3rd class return railway fare and 15/- per diem maintenance allowance.

A further amendment was moved by LIAM DE ROISTE (Cork City) and seconded by P. O CAOIMH (Cork North) to the effect that “The Constituencies be asked to maintain their Deputies so as to enable them to attend meetings of Dáil Eireann.” This amendment was withdrawn on the Priomh-Aire agreeing to prefix the words “as long as it is necessary” to his motion, and the original motion thus amended was put and carried.

MainHeading.Title: MINISTERIAL REPORTS. - MOTION TO SANCTION ISSUE OF OFFICIAL GAZETTE.
MainHeading.P: “That ‘The Official Gazette’ (No. 1) recording the transactions of the first public Session of Dáil be authorised for immediate issue to the public at 2/6 per copy, and that the editing and issuing of a second number, recording the transactions of the next public Session be entrusted to the charge of the Deputy for Westmeath (L. GINNELL).”
Motion seconded by P. O MAILLE (Connemara), put and agreed to.
The House thereupon adjourned to 3.30 in the afternoon.

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO STANDING ORDERS. - MOTION TO AMEND STANDING ORDER 7a.
MainHeading.P: GABHAN O DUBHTHAIGH (South Co. Dublin) moved to amend Standing Order 7a by striking out the first paragraph down to the words “at which he moves” (inclusive) and inserting the words following in lieu of the words (struck out, viz.—“A Deputy proposing a motion shall give one day's written notice of the motion to the Chairman or his Clerk.”
This motion was seconded by COUNTESS MARKIEVICZ (St. Patrick's) and put and carried.

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO STANDING ORDERS. - MOTION TO AMEND STANDING ORDER 12a.
MainHeading.P: EAMONN DE VALERA (East Clare) moved, and GABHAN O DUBHTHAIGH (South Co. Dublin) seconded, to amend Standing Order 12a by substituting therefor the following:—

“A quorum for conducting business at a meeting of Dáil shall consist of one half of the Deputies who have signed the Roll and who are in Ireland and not prevented from attendance by enemy action, or of twenty Deputies, whichever shall be the greater number.”

L. MAC FHIONNGHAIL (Westmeath) moved: “That a quorum for legislative and general business be as laid down in the resolution, but in the event of this number not being free Ten to be the quorum for administrative purposes.” This was not seconded.
The original motion was then put and carried.

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO STANDING ORDERS. - AMENDMENT TO STANDING ORDER 13.
MainHeading.P: GABHAN O DUBHTHAIGH (Dublin Co., South) moved and EAMONN DE VALERA (East Clare) seconded that:—

“Standing Order 13 be amended by striking out the present text and substituting the following clause:—‘Until normal Government is established, Dáil shall meet in private and strangers shall be excluded, except that a visitor may at any time be invited to be present by the Chairman and that accredited representatives of the Press may be present whenever Dáil shall by resolution have determined to sit in Public Session.’”
This motion was withdrawn and the following amendment was, on the motion of COUNTESS MARKIEVICZ (St. Patrick's), seconded by JAMES O'MARA (S. Kilkenny), passed, viz.:—

“That Standing Order No. 13 be amended by transposition (i.e., that it should read): ‘Visitors introduced by a Deputy and authorised representatives of the Press may be present during the sitting of the Dáil, unless the Dáil by resolution or the Chairman otherwise determine.’”

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO STANDING ORDERS. - AMENDMENT TO STANDING ORDER 8 (f).
MainHeading.P: EAMONN DE VALERA (East Clare) moved, and COUNTESS MARKIEVICZ (St. Patrick's) seconded, “that Standing Order 8 (f) be amended by substituting therefor the following:—
‘8 (f) Deputies shall be referred to by the names of their constituencies.
‘(g) No Deputy shall make a personal charge against another nor use offensive remarks about another.’ The existing clauses g, h, i, j, k, to be re-lettered h, i, j, k, l, respectively.”

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO STANDING ORDERS. - AMENDMENT TO STANDING ORDER 1 (b).
MainHeading.P: A motion by ENRI O BEOLAIN (S Roscommon), seconded by GABHAN O DUBHTHAIGH (South Co. Dublin), to amend Standing Order 1 (b) by adding the words “and may be accompanied by an authorised English translation” was withdrawn upon an undertaking being given that all notices and pronouncements would be issued bilingually.

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO STANDING ORDERS. - PROPOSED ADDITION TO THE STANDING ORDERS.
MainHeading.P: SEAN MAC AN TSAOI (Monaghan South) moved and JOSEPH MAC DONAGH (Tipperary North) seconded: that a Standing Order be adopted providing that “All reports and where possible all notices of motion to be considered by the Dáil shall be printed and be available for perusal by the Deputies, at least on the morning of the Session at which the said reports or notices of motion are to be considered.”
This motion was withdrawn upon an undertaking being given that copies of such documents shall be available for perusal at the Clerk's table one hour before the opening of each Session.

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO STANDING ORDERS. - AMENDMENT TO STANDING ORDER, 4 (c).
MainHeading.P: On the motion of J.J. WALSH (Cork City), seconded by COUNTESS MARKIEVICZ (St. Patrick's), it was agreed to amend Standing Order 4 (c) to read as follows:—
“The business of Dáil shall commence at the appointed time provided that a quorum be present.”

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO CONSTITUTION
MainHeading.P: Pursuant to seven days notice of motion.

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO CONSTITUTION - AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE 2 (d).
MainHeading.P: GABHAN O DUBHTHAIGH (South Co. Dublin) moved, and P. O MAILLE (Connemara), seconded that Clause 2 (d) be amended by the insertion after the word, “President” of the following words, viz:—“Or during the meeting at which the President shall himself have been elected to his office.”

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO CONSTITUTION - ADDITION TO ARTICLE 2.
MainHeading.P: GABHAN O DUBHTHAIGH (South Co. Dublin) moved, and CATHAL BRUGHA (Waterford Co.) seconded: that Article 2 of the Constitution be amended by the addition of the following Clause, viz.:—“2 (g) The President may himself in writing nominate from among the Members of the Ministry a President-Substitute who shall act in his place and exercise all his powers (including the power to nominate a President-Substitute with Presidential Status, and the power to nominate Substitute Ministers) in the event of the President becoming unable by reason of enemy action, or absence abroad, or illness, or other emergency, to perform the functions of his office; if occasion arises for the President Substitute to assume office he shall act as President of the Ministry until the President resumes his functions or resigns, or until he himself becomes unable by reason of enemy action, absence abroad, illness, or other emergency, to perform the functions of the office; if at any time there is no President or President-Substitute, or if there is no President or President-Substitute able to perform the functions of the Presidential Office, a meeting of Dail shall be convened to elect a President.”
Question put and carried after discussion.
[The Deputy for East Clare— Eamonn de Valera—after his election as President—undertook that a President-Substitute should submit his nomination for approval by Dáil after assuming office.]

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO CONSTITUTION - FURTHER ADDITION TO ARTICLE 2.
MainHeading.P: GABHAN O DUBHTHAIGH (South Co. Dublin) moved, and P. O'MAILLE (Connemara) seconded, to further amend Article 2 by the addition of the following Clause:

“2 (h). Whenever any Member of the Ministry other than the President shall become unable by reason of enemy action, absence abroad, illness, or other emergency, to perform the functions of his office, the President may forthwith—and shall if the incapacity shall extend over thirty days —appoint another Deputy as Minister- Substitute to fill his place and exercise all his powers during his absence, but the name of every Substitute-Minister shall be submitted for approval to the next meeting of Dáil after his appointment if the incapacity of the original Minister then continues.”

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO CONSTITUTION - AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE 2 (b).
MainHeading.P: EAMONN DE VALERA (East Clare) moved, and M. O COILEAIN (Cork, South) seconded, that Article 2 (b) of the Constitution should be amended to read as follows:—
“The Ministry shall consist of a President of the Ministry elected by Dáil Eireann, and not more than nine Executive Officers, including:—
each of whom the President shall nominate and have power to dismiss.”
An objection that this motion was not within the terms of the notice was overruled.
The House divided on the proposed amendment, and the motion was declared carried.

MainHeading.Title: AMENDMENTS TO CONSTITUTION - AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE 4.
MainHeading.P: GABHAN O DUBHTHAIGH (South Co. Dublin, moved, and CATHAL BRUGHA (Waterford Co.) seconded, to amend Article 4 by substituting for the words, “twice yearly” the words, “During the month of November, 1919, and thereafter twice yearly.”

MainHeading.Title: RESIGNATION OF MINISTRY.
MainHeading.P: The PRIOMH-AIRE tendered his resignation and that of his Ministry to the House, which, after a vote of thanks had been proposed by A. GRIFFITH (East Cavan), seconded by E. DE VALERA (East Clare) and passed with acclamation, was accepted.

MainHeading.Title: ELECTION OF PRESIDENT OF DAIL.
MainHeading.P: On the motion of CATHAL BRUGHA (Waterford Co.), seconded by P. O MAILLE (Connemara), EAMON DE VALERA (East Clare) was declared elected Priomh-Aire.
The CEANN COMHAIRLE having announced that the House would reassemble at 2.30 p.m. on 2nd inst., the proceedings concluded at 7.5 p.m.
